tooltip-pt-homepage:
Tooltip shown when hovering the mouse over the link to your own Homepage in the upper-side personal toolbox.

{{doc-growthexperiments-homepage}}
prefs-homepage:
Text of the section header for the "Newcomer homepage" section in Special:Preferences.

{{doc-growthexperiments-homepage}}
growthexperiments-homepage-enable:
Text of the preference in Special:Preferences to enable the homepage tab to show when viewing one's User or User Talk page.

{{doc-growthexperiments-homepage}}
growthexperiments-homepage-pt-link:
Text of the preference in Special:Preferences to make the username link in the personal tools go to the homepage instead of the userpage.

{{doc-growthexperiments-homepage}}
growthexperiments-homepage-account-heade:
Title of the newcomer homepage account created module, which confirms to the user that their account has been created.

{{doc-growthexperiments-homepage}}
growthexperiments-homepage-userpage-butt:
Text of the button on the userpage module that links to the user page when the user page does not yet exist.

{{doc-growthexperiments-homepage}}

Text of the button on the userpage module that links to the user page when the user page already exists.

{{doc-growthexperiments-homepage}}
growthexperiments-homepage-userpage-guid:
Text of the link that goes to the local version of Wikipedia:User_pages, so that users can learn how to make a good user page.

{{doc-growthexperiments-homepage}}
growthexperiments-homepage-email-button-:
Text of the button that links to a form where the user can add an email address (Special:ChangeEmail), in the email module on the newcomer homepage.

{{doc-growthexperiments-homepage}}

Text of the button that links to a page where the user can send a new confirmation email (Special:ConfirmEmail), in the email module on the newcomer homepage.

{{doc-growthexperiments-homepage}}
growthexperiments-homepage-email-changel:
Text of the link that lets the user change their email address, in the email module on the newcomer homepage. The link takes the user to the email section on the preferences page. This link is only displayed if the user has set an email address, but has not yet confirmed it.

{{doc-growthexperiments-homepage}}
growthexperiments-homepage-startediting-:
Title of the start editing module on the newcomer homepage.

{{doc-growthexperiments-homepage}}

Body text of the start editing module on the newcomer homepage if the user said on Special:WelcomeSurvey that they created an account to fix a typo.

{{doc-growthexperiments-homepage}}

Body text of the start editing module on the newcomer homepage if the user said on Special:WelcomeSurvey that they created an account to add an image.

{{doc-growthexperiments-homepage}}

Body text of the start editing module on the newcomer homepage if the user said on Special:WelcomeSurvey that they created an account to create a new article.

{{doc-growthexperiments-homepage}}

Body text of the start editing module on the newcomer homepage if the user said on Special:WelcomeSurvey that they created an account for another reason (that there isn't a specific message for).

{{doc-growthexperiments-homepage}}

Text of the button in the start editing module on the newcomer homepage that starts the suggested edits process.

{{doc-growthexperiments-homepage}}

Text of the button in the topic panel (first stage) of the suggested edits dialog that exits the dialog.

{{doc-growthexperiments-homepage}}

Text of the button in the difficulty panel (second stage) of the suggested edits dialog that navigates back to the topic panel (first stage).

{{doc-growthexperiments-homepage}}

Text of the button in the difficulty panel (second stage) of the suggested edits dialog that closes the dialog and saves the user's choices.

{{doc-growthexperiments-homepage}}

Text of the header near the top of the difficulty panel (second stage) of the suggested edits dialog. This text appears in bold, and the text in <nowiki><strong></nowiki> tags appears in green.

{{doc-growthexperiments-homepage}}

Text that appears right below the header of the difficulty panel (second stage) of the suggested edits dialog.

{{doc-growthexperiments-homepage}}

Label for the lowest difficulty level in the difficulty panel of the suggested edits dialog.

{{doc-growthexperiments-homepage}}

Label for the middle difficulty level in the difficulty panel of the suggested edits dialog.

{{doc-growthexperiments-homepage}}

Label for the highest difficulty level in the difficulty panel of the suggested edits dialog.

{{doc-growthexperiments-homepage}}

Header above the description for the lowest difficulty level in the difficulty panel of the suggested edits dialog.

{{doc-growthexperiments-homepage}}

Header above the description for the middle difficulty level in the difficulty panel of the suggested edits dialog.

{{doc-growthexperiments-homepage}}

Header above the description for the highest difficulty level in the difficulty panel of the suggested edits dialog.

{{doc-growthexperiments-homepage}}

Description for the lowest difficulty level in the difficulty panel of the suggested edits dialog.

{{doc-growthexperiments-homepage}}
growthexperiments-homepage-suggested-edi:
Title of the newcomer homepage Suggested Edits module, which offers recommended editing tasks.

{{doc-growthexperiments-homepage}}
growthexperiments-homepage-impact-subhea:
Subtitle of the newcomer homepage Impact module.
* $1 - Name of the current user. Can be used with GENDER.

Sub-subtitle of the newcomer homepage Impact module, explaining that the module displays the pageviews of articles the user edited.
* $1 - Name of the current user. Can be used with GENDER.
growthexperiments-homepage-impact-contri:
Text of the link in the Impact module to Special:Contributions.  The link says the user's total edit count.
* $1 - Edit count of the current user.
* $2 - Name of the current user. Can be used with GENDER.

{{doc-growthexperiments-homepage}}
growthexperiments-homepage-impact-subhea:
Subtitle of the newcomer homepage Impact module when the user has not edited any article yet, explaining that they have not yet edited any articles.
* $1 - Name of the current user. Can be used with GENDER.

Subtitle of the newcomer homepage Impact module when the user has made edits but page views are not yet available.
* $1 - Name of the current user. Can be used with GENDER.
growthexperiments-homepage-impact-contri:
Text of the link to Special:Contributions when the user has not edited any article yet, but has edited in other namespaces.  The link says the user's edit count in namespaces other than the article namespace.
* $1 - Edit count of the current user.
* $2 - Name of the current user. Can be used with GENDER.

{{doc-growthexperiments-homepage}}
growthexperiments-homepage-impact-articl:
Tooltip in the Impact module of the link that takes users to an article listed in the module.

{{doc-growthexperiments-homepage}}
growthexperiments-homepage-impact-pagevi:
Tooltip in the Impact module of the link that takes users to the pageviews analysis tool (https://tools.wmflabs.org/pageviews)

{{doc-growthexperiments-homepage}}
growthexperiments-homepage-impact-empty-:
Tooltip in the Impact module of the icon displayed when page views are not yet available because an edit is too recent.

{{doc-growthexperiments-homepage}}

Text of the button to dismiss the tooltip (on mobile only) in the Impact module of the icon displayed when page views are not yet available because an edit is too recent.

{{doc-growthexperiments-homepage}}
growthexperiments-homepage-impact-mobile:
Text in the Impact module mobile summary view that precedes the total page views of the recent edits to articles.

{{doc-growthexperiments-homepage}}

First line of text in the Impact module mobile summary view.

{{doc-growthexperiments-homepage}}
growthexperiments-tour-helpdesk-response:
Title of a popup pointing at the incoming messages inbox icon to inform users about where they will be able to find replies from the community help desk.

{{doc-growthexperiments-homepage}}
growthexperiments-tour-mentor-response-t:
Title of a popup pointing at the incoming messages inbox icon to inform users about where they will be able to find replies from mentors.

{{doc-growthexperiments-homepage}}

Description of the incoming messages inbox feature shown to new users after they send a question to their mentor.
* $1 - Current user's name, to be used with GENDER.
* $2 - Mentor's gender, to be used with GENDER.

{{doc-growthexperiments-homepage}}
growthexperiments-tour-response-button-o:
Button which allows the user to confirm that they understood the related explanation text.

{{doc-growthexperiments-homepage}}
tag-help_module_question:
Short change tag name for edits made by the post a question feature in the help module, which allows users to post questions directly to their wiki's help desk.

{{doc-growthexperiments-homepage}}
tag-help_module_question-description:
Short change tag description for edits made by the post a question feature in the help module, which allows users to post questions directly to their wiki's help desk.

{{doc-growthexperiments-homepage}}
tag-mentorship_module_question:
Short change tag name for edits made by the post a question feature in the mentorship module, which allows users to post questions directly to the talk page of another experienced user on wiki.

{{doc-growthexperiments-homepage}}
tag-mentorship_module_question-descripti:
Short change tag description for edits made by the post a question feature in the mentorship module, which allows users to post questions directly to the talk page of another experienced user on wiki.

{{doc-growthexperiments-homepage}}
growthexperiments-homepage-help-dialog-t:
Title of the dialog to ask a question to the help desk from the homepage.

{{doc-growthexperiments-homepage}}
growthexperiments-homepage-help-header:
Title of the help module, which gives users useful links and allows them to ask a question directly to the help desk

{{doc-growthexperiments-homepage}}
growthexperiments-homepage-help-subheade:
Text to show in the subheader of the help module, above a list of the five most useful help links on the wiki.

{{doc-growthexperiments-homepage}}
growthexperiments-homepage-help-cancel:
Text shown on a button to close the dialog for asking a question to the help desk.

{{doc-growthexperiments-homepage}}
growthexperiments-homepage-help-mobilebo:
Text shown in the body of the summary version of the Help module on mobile.

{{doc-growthexperiments-homepage}}
growthexperiments-homepage-recent-questi:
Text to show alongside a link to the archived question that the user posted.

{{doc-growthexperiments-homepage}}

Text to show in the title attribute of a link to an archived question.

{{doc-growthexperiments-homepage}}
growthexperiments-homepage-mentorship-he:
Header of the mentorship module, which assigns an experienced editor to all new users so that they can ask for help.
* $1 - Name of the current user. Can be used with GENDER.
* $2 - Name of the mentor. Can be used with GENDER.

{{doc-growthexperiments-homepage}}
growthexperiments-homepage-mentorship-me:
Text in the mentorship module for when the user's mentor's latest edit was two or more days ago, shown along with how many days ago.
* $1 - Name of the mentor. Can be used with GENDER.
* $2 - Number of days since the edit was made. Can be used with PLURAL.

{{doc-growthexperiments-homepage}}
growthexperiments-homepage-mentorship-in:
Message in the mentorship module that explains who the mentor is and how they can help.
* $1 - Name of the mentor. Can be used with GENDER.
* $2 - Name of the current user. Can be used with GENDER.

{{doc-growthexperiments-homepage}}
growthexperiments-homepage-mentorship-qu:
Text in the mentorship module on the button that allows the user to ask a question to their mentor.
* $1 - Name of the mentor. Can be used with GENDER.
* $2 - Name of the current user. Can be used with GENDER.

{{doc-growthexperiments-homepage}}
growthexperiments-homepage-mentorship-me:
Text in the mentorship module of the link that brings the user to their mentor's talk page, so they can see other conversations the mentor has had.
* $1 - Name of the mentor. Can be used with GENDER.
* $2 - Name of the current user. Can be used with GENDER.

{{doc-growthexperiments-homepage}}
growthexperiments-homepage-mentorship-di:
Title of the dialog to ask a question to a mentor from the homepage.
* $1 - Name of the mentor. Can be used with GENDER.
* $2 - Name of the current user. Can be used with GENDER.

{{doc-growthexperiments-homepage}}
growthexperiments-homepage-mentorship-qu:
Header shown on the screen where users type their question to their mentor.
* $1 - Name of the mentor. Can be used with GENDER.
* $2 - Name of the current user. Can be used with GENDER.
* $3 - Link to the mentor's talk page.

{{doc-growthexperiments-homepage}}

Text of the link to the mentor's talk page used as an argument to {{msg-mw|growthexperiments-homepage-mentorship-questionreview-header}}.
* $1 - Name of the mentor. Can be used with GENDER.
* $2 - Name of the current user. Can be used with GENDER.

{{doc-growthexperiments-homepage}}
growthexperiments-homepage-mentorship-co:
Confirmation text after a user has posted a question to their mentor's talk page.
* $1 - Name of the mentor. Can be used with GENDER.
* $2 - Name of the current user. Can be used with GENDER.

{{doc-growthexperiments-homepage}}
growthexperiments-homepage-mentorship-vi:
Text of the link to view the question that the user just posted to the mentor's talk page.
* $1 - Name of the mentor. Can be used with GENDER.
* $2 - Name of the current user. Can be used with GENDER.

Title of the tutorial module, which gives users a link to a tutorial so they can learn to edit.

growthexperiments-homepage-tutorial-subh:
Body text of the tutorial module, which gives users a link to a tutorial so they can learn to edit.

growthexperiments-homepage-tutorial-cta-:
Text on the button in the tutorial module that opens up the tutorial.

Title for Special:Impact, a page that displays just a module listing the pageviews on pages a user has edited

Error text to show if an invalid username is supplied as an argument to Special:Impact.

growthexperiments-tour-discovery-title:
Title text used with Guided Tour shown to user to help with [Special:Homepage] discovery.

{{doc-growthexperiments-homepage}}

Text used with banner for desktop no-JS users to help discover [Special:Homepage]. Parameters:
* $1 - Current user's name, to be used with GENDER.
* $2 - Icon for a user avatar and the current user's account name.

{{doc-growthexperiments-homepage}}
growthexperiments-homepage-discovery-tha:
Text used with site notice for desktop no-JS users after creating an account and returning to pre-account creation context. Parameters:
* $1 - Name of the current user. Can be used with GENDER.
* $2 - Icon for a user avatar and the current user's account name.

{{doc-growthexperiments-homepage}}
growthexperiments-homepage-discovery-mob:
Title used in a sitenotice-style banner for mobile users after creating an account and navigating to the homepage. (The text is in {{msg-mw|growthexperiments-homepage-discovery-mobile-homepage-banner-text}}.)

Parameters:
* $1 - Name of the current user (to be used with GENDER).

Same as {{msg-mw|growthexperiments-homepage-discovery-banner-header}}.

Parameters:
